name: JW Marriott Guanacaste Resort & Spa Costa Rica

reviews.title: Beautiful spot; poor food; could be anywhere
reviews.text: The facility is a very pretty, spread-out resort complex of the kind that abounds in, say, Cancun or Puerta Vallarta. Apart from the local employees, the facility is completely disconnected from Costa Rica and even from its immediate surroundings. (And due to still-unrepaired hurricane damage from years ago, the unpaved road to the hotel is many miles of bumps and dust.) This hotel could be anywhere. It is decorated in Spanish hacienda style - even though these were never built in Costa Rica. During our stay, the hotel allowed vendors to sell wares from tables in the open-air lobby area -- not a problem, except that they were specializing in (supposedly) baby alpaca scarves from Peru. One would think a Marriott in Costa Rica would help support Costa Rican crafts people. The rooms are spacious and very well maintained. Top quality bedding, towels, etc. Great air conditioning. But, the main attractions of a resort of this kind were lacking: the food was bland and unconscionably expensive; the sandy beach is pretty and nice, but it is rough and rocky if you enter the water (although the sunset is beautiful); and service was sketchy (enjoying our $12 basic cocktails at the lobby bar, we watched a customer at another table try to order three different drinks listed on the bar's own drink menu only to be told they were not available!). Bottom line: if you want this kind of experience, there is no reason to go to Costa Rica to get it, and you will do better for this kind of experience elsewhere. It is truly a shame that Marriott sort of dropped a resort onto this beautiful spot without any apparent regard for its Costa Rican locale. I felt slightly ashamed about the whole thing.

reviews.title: A little piece of paradise

reviews.text: One tip however is to use www.airporttransfercostarica.com. Ask for either Manuel or Heriberto. The hotel is very isolated, but we were able to get around fine with the help of Heriberto. He picked us up at the Liberia airport as well as drove us to dinner and to some of the most amazing local attractions. They are a much smaller company then the one offered at the hotel (swiss travel) and were able to offer very personalized service. It felt as we had our own personal driver/tour guide for the week. When we go back we will only use www.airporttransfercostarica.com. for all our transportation and tour guide needs.
reviews.title: I loved this resort!!

reviews.text: So we just returned from the JW - and it was by far the best vacation that we have ever had as a family. As the parents of small children, we wanted a destination that they would not only enjoy, but feel safe. And Costa Rica is the idea destination - you can drink the water, eat the food and relax. And what an amazing place for the kids to learn how to surf. Our biggest concern was that the JW might be "stuffy" but it couldn't have been farther from it. The resort staff was amazing and made our children feel soooo welcome. If you want an amazing resort - go to the JW. If you want an AI swim up bar with no children and nightly "entertainment", might I suggest somewhere else.

aka: Jw Marriott Guanacaste Resort & Spa Costa Rica Hotel Santa Cruz
description: Exclusive beachfront property, adjacent to a world class golf course, featuring the largest pool in Central America and one of the best Spas as rated by the Spa Magazine. At JW Marriott Guanacaste Resort & Spa you will discover traditional Costa Rican warmth with world class luxury. Fast being recognized as one of the most magnificent in Latin America, this resort is located on the country's northwestern pacific coast, just 5 Miles away from Tamarindo and with convenient International access thru Liberia International airport. We offer the comforts and luxuries in an environment that is richly and authentically Costa Rican, designed for a family vacation or a couple getaway. Our 310 guest rooms provide a private haven of luxurious comfort with rich woods and fine linens. The resort is peacefully surrounded by the splendors of Costa Rican nature; with a choice of 3 beaches, equestrian center, 18-hole golf course designed by Mike Young and world classes Spa…will surely make your stay one to remember.
